title: Orientation & Introduction
purpose: Introduce users to the Candidate Simulator, its scaffolded learning structure, and the scoring system using Candidate Coins, signatures, and voter approval.
summary: This module explains how the simulator works — including how to read, write, and speak in sequence, earn Candidate Coins (CC), collect signatures, and track voter approval. It also introduces the concept of penalties and the importance of clarity over politics.

phases.title: Scaffolded Learning
phases.description: Read → Write → Speak. Each stage helps build campaign discipline and communication skill.

phases.title: Candidate Coins (CC)
phases.description: 1 CC = $100 simulated funds. Earn CC by completing quizzes and tasks. Spend CC on coaching or campaign resources.

phases.title: Scoring & Penalties
phases.description: Quizzes earn signatures and CC. Wrong answers deduct CC or signatures. Retakes double penalties, simulating real-world FEC administrative costs.

phases.title: Simulator Purpose
phases.description: Combines real FEC processes with simulation mechanics so you can safely learn campaign operations before real filings.

task: Select your office: President, Senate, or House. Your choice determines your filing costs and approval threshold.

narration.intro: Welcome to the Federal Candidate Simulator — AI Edition. You begin with 50 CC, 0 signatures, and 0% voter approval.
narration.prompt: Type which office you want to run for: President, Senate, or House.
